oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First record of the invasive gecko, Lepidodactylus lugubris Duméril & Bibron, 1836 in mainland Chile (Squamata, Gekkonidae)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Urra, Felix
Zúñiga, Alejandro
Miranda-Calle, Alejandro Bruno
Melero, Nel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gekkonidae
invasion biology
invasive species
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>In Chile, the presence of Mourning Gecko, <jats:italic>Lepidodactylus lugubris</jats:italic> Duméril & Bibron, 1836 has been recognized for Easter Island (Rapa Nui) from late 19<jats:sup>th</jats:sup> century. Here, we report the first observation of a juvenile specimen of <jats:italic>L. lugubris</jats:italic> in an urban zone of Santiago, Región Metropolitana, mainland Chile, representing the southernmost non-insular record in America for this invasive species. Moreover, an updated distributional map of <jats:italic>L. lugubris</jats:italic> for South America and the Antilles is provided.</jats:p>
